data.title: Radio Javan
data.text:
Reza Yazdani performed live on March 14th and 16th in Milad Tower. He's among the limited number of Rock style singers in Iran and that helps his popularity. There were many artists who attended Yazdani's concert. Among them were Mazyar Fallahi, Elnaz Shakerdoust, Shahram Shokouhi, Rambod Javan, Soroush Sehat, Pejman Jamshidi, Abdoljabar Kakaei, Melika Sharifinia and Saam Derakhshan.

Like his other concert, his concert was sold out. Performing "Adam Ye Jahaee Ro Majboureh" brought tears to Reza's eyes and he wasn't able to talk after that. He had to leave the scene for few minutes. Reza's performance of "Koocheye Melli" received great feedback from audience as well. This song got picked by Googoosh in 2011 Googoosh Music Academy.

Exclusive Photos by: Saalaar Pizari Photography

Vote for Asghar Farhadi to be on Time 100, by clicking HERE

Time asks you to cast your votes for the leaders, artists, innovators, icons and heroes that you think are the most influential people in the world.

Official voting ends on Friday, April 6 so cast your vote and ask your friends to do the same.

Good Luck Mr. Farhadi!

به اصغر فرهادی رای بدهید که بخشی از ۱۰۰ شخص برتر سال ۲۰۱۲ مجله تایم شود

Radio Javan is proud to announce DJ Ramin as the new host for the popular 'Playback' show.

DJ Ramin has become well-known among persian music lovers for his unique style and his masterful skill of making remixes of such popular songs such as: Mohsen Yeganeh - Sokoot, Benyamin - Bia Ashegham Kon, and Nadia Ali - Is It Love among many others that has been repeatedly used by other Persian DJs worldwide.

DJ Ramin spends time and effort to produce music and remix songs instead of doing a mashup. Producing a mix involves creating original beats that needs to be matched with the song being remixed versus doing a mashup, which is just mixing two songs or beats together.

In Playback DJ Ramin will entertain listeners with one hour of up beat high energy mix and will always include few remixes of his own which you will only be able to hear it in his show.

Radio Javan welcomes DJ Ramin to its growing family of resident DJs; stay tuned for the release of the first episode of Playback show with DJ Ramin on April 14, 2012.

Mazyar Fallahi, one of the most popular singers of Iran, performed live in Milad Tower on 17th and 18th of March. His performace was one of the best this year and it he started with "Doroughe" and ended with the same song. He got emotional explaining the story of one of his fans who was supposed to come to the concert but died from cancer. Exclusive Photos by: Saalaar Pizari Photography

Mazyar Fallahi, one of the most popular singers of Iran, performed live in Milad Tower on 17th and 18th of March. His performace was one of the best this year and it he started with "Doroughe" and ended with the same song. He got emotional explaining the story of one of his fans who was supposed to come to the concert but died from cancer. Mazyar sang "Bezarin Beram" with playing guitar in memory of this fan.

Click here to view all 34 photos:

Some of guest were Reza Yazdani, Shahram Shokouhi, Maryam Heydarzadeh and Pejman Jamshidi. Jamshidi used to play for the national soccer team of Iran and he gave his jersey to Mazyar at this concert.

Mazyar bowed down in front of the guests and kissed the stage. That made the 8000 people who were there those two nights to stand up and applause him.

Exclusive Photos by: Saalaar Pizari Photography

مازیار فلاحی چهرۀ بسیار محبوب این روز های موسیقی کشور در تاریخ ۲۷ و ۲۸ اسفندماه (هر شب دو سانس) با عاشقانه های خود آخرین کنسرت سال را در سالن همایش های برج میلاد اجرا کرد و به جرات می توان گفت این ۴ اجرا جزو بهترین اجراهای سال ۱۳۹۰ در تهران بودند.

یک ویدئو و یک فیلم کوتاه با همکاری سالار پیزری و مازیار فلاحی برای این کنسرت آماده شده بود، که ویدئو اول قبل از شروع برنامه پخش شد، این ویدئو شامل تصاویری بود از تمرین مازیار به همراه گروه اش در استودیو و فراز و نشیب های روزهای قبل از اجرا.

ویدئو دوم در مورد داوود جعفری بود، داوود یکی از نوازندگان گروه مازیار است که با وجود نابینائی مادر زادی ای که دارد موفق شده است مدرک فوق لیسانس موسیقی اش را بگیرد! این فیلم مفهومی در دقایق آخر خودش دنیا را از دید داوود به نمایش میگذاشت.

این کنسرت به یاد ماندنی با اجرای قطعۀ "دروغه" هم آغاز شد و هم با پایان رسید.

مازیار که بغض گلویش را گرفته بود در مورد یکی از هوادارانش صحبت کرد که چندی پیش به دلیل علاقۀ شدیدی که به مازیار داشته قراری در دفتر تهیه کننده کنسرت های مازیار صورت میدهد تا مازیار را از نزدیک ببیند، این خانم بلیط کنسرت رو هم تهیه کرده بودند که به دیدن این اجرا بیان، اما متاسفانه بیماری سرطان به ایشون فرصت نداد... و چند روز قبل از کنسرت این خانم فوت شدند، مازیار گفت که تا زمانی که روی صحنه میام به یاد ایشون یک صندلی خالی در سالن خواهم گذاشت، مازیار گیتار به دست شد و قطعۀ "بذارین برم" رو به روح این عزیز تقدیم کرد، با کمی تغییر در شعر آهنگ، این آهنگ بیشتر با موضوع مرتبط شده بود...

نمیخوام دیگه بمونم، به لبم رسیده جونم، دکترهای مهربونم، بذارین برم از اینجا...

رضا یزدانی، شهرام شکوهی، مریم حیدرزاده، پژمان جمشیدی از چهره های سرشناس داخل سالن بودند.

پژمان جمشیدی ملی پوش تیم فوتبال کشورمون، پیرهن ملی خودش رو در این کنسرت با مازیار هدیه کرد.

مازیار در انتهای اجرای خودش در مقابل هوادارانش به زانو در آمد و صحنه را بوسید، این کار باعث شد که حدود ۸۰۰۰ نفری که در این دو شب به دیدن این کنسرت آمده بودند برای احترام مقابل از صندلی خود بلند شده، بایستند و از مازیار تقدیر کنند.

عکس ها: سالار پیزری

After a world wide search for the most talented Persian vocalists and instrumentalists between 15-35 years old, Star Musician just recently announced their Top 40 Quarter-Finalists. The Quarter-Finalists were chosen by Star Musician judges Andy Madadian, Farokh Elton Ahi, Ardeshir Farah, Paksima Zakipour and Siros Kerdouni.

Now it's the publics turn to judge the contestants, as their votes will account for 50% of the scoring. Click Here to see all the talented contestants and start voting for your favorites today! Public voting for this round ends on April 15th and the Top 20 will advance to the Semi-Finals round.

شما در مجموع میتوانید به ۲۰ ویدیو رأی بدهید. از این میان ۱۰ رأی برای خوانندها و ۱۰ رأی هم برای نوازندگان مورد علاقه شما در نظر گرفته شده است. در پایان دوره رأی گیری ۱۰ خواننده و ۱۰ نوازنده برتر که بیشترین رأی را کسب کرده اند به مرحله نیمه نهایی راه خواهند یافت

Over the past few months, I have featured fifteen of the best songs from previous decades. However, I have yet to feature a song from the new generation. This is about to change as this week’s Yadegari is dedicated to Mansour’s ‘Ghararemoon Yadet Nareh’.

Born in July 28, 1971, Mansour is one of the most famous singers to come out of exiled Persian community in Los Angeles. In 1994, he released his first album, ‘Fer Ferehaye Bee Baad’. From there, he released three albums before releasing one of his most popular albums ‘Faghat Beh Khatereh Tou’ in 1999. He followed that with ‘Zendegi’ in 2001 and it was around this time that he began sporting his trademark long hair, mustache, and beard. Then in 2002, he released arguably his best album, ‘Divooneh’. This album features my favorite Mansour song, ‘Ghararemoon Yadet Nareh’.

You can watch the official music video below and if you like it, you can download the song here. Enjoy!

According to the Hollywood Reporter, Bravo TV has just announced that "Shahs of Sunset" will be renewed for a second season. The controversial reality show featuring six affluent Persians in Los Angeles just wrapped up its season finale which received over 1.5 million total viewers. It was the show's most-watched episode.

The show became a lightning rod of public anger as soon as it was announced, with many claiming the show and the cast does not represent all Iranians and does Iran's culture a disservice. There was even a resolution by the West Hollywood City Council condemning the Bravo show "for perpetuating negative stereotypes about Iranian-Americans."

But then as the show wrapped up its first season, it also found many fans. Including those who see the show as simply just another reality show for entertainment. Many also say that "Shahs of Sunset" does in fact represent the (ugly) truth, and the cast is no different than a good majority of other young Iranians in LA.

The cast itself certainly have branched out by making names for themselves. For example, Reza Farahan and his epic "Mustache" rant.

Whether you hate or love "Shahs of Sunset", one thing is for sure -- people like to watch it (maybe even because of the controversies) and the show will be back for more.
